intro: Penicillaria stenostachya, commonly known as the narrow-staminal penicillaria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are often a vibrant yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
